sentences.sContent: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.sCn: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.sContent: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.sCn: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

words.tran: 使人尴尬的；令人为难的
使人尴尬地；令人难堪地
窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

remMethod.val: em ＋ barr(看作bar， 酒吧) ＋ ass(蠢驴) → 在酒吧喝醉了表现得像头驴 → 使窘迫

trans.tranOther: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public
